sn29.3:1.3: Dragons who wished to be reborn as a human were encouraged to observe the sabbath (Kd 1:63.4.3, Ja 506), during which they would cast off their serpent form (vossaṭṭhakāyā) and appear human (snakes are experts at skin-shedding). This seems to have been misunderstood in later days to imply that they should literally sacrifice their bodies, a belief unsupported in early Buddhism (Ja 524).
sn29.3:2.2: “Both kinds of deeds” (dvayakārino): both good and bad. Contrast the good deeds for being reborn as a centaur (SN 31.2).
